column4: hmm.. hopefully someone can help me, I connected the laptop and PC with a crossover cable, I want the PC to receive internet through the laptop's wireless. So far dhcp between the laptop and PC has been doing swell, the ping is good. But when I start firestarter with internet sharing available the PC is still unable to connect to the internet. I tried the command line way, still no luck, is...
...it prob. because of the configuration?
chip search grub
chimp*
ahh but i tried that though ;)
jum, neither i think
chimp grub is what manages operating systems when you startup your computer
Ive used it before and forgotten its name,
chimp you can do it by command line easily
It adds to grub an option for installing another OS
again you can do it by command line, all it does is edit a text file.
menu.lst to be exact
chimp if you really need to, go to synaptic and search grub, you may find it there
You can direct grub to load an iso on boot?
chimp to load a cd? for what reason.
I want to install another os, have no cd drive, no usb, etc.
chimp oh gosh, that just makes things harder ;), especialy when you said no usb
I know it can be done within the os, ive done it before, cant remeber name of the program, and googling wont help
i'm not sure abou that. let me do a quick google
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=554716 chimp
didn't take that long , now did it;)
but chimp, careful though, you need to know which device it's on (root)
This laptop is very slow,  (which is why i want to install a less resource intensive os)
